Vikki, any idea why installing more fonts would kill CTabFolder?

The only reason I could think of is that the font size is a pinhead.  The code 
that is failing is trying to set the size of the arrow drawn in the scroll 
left/scroll right button to be porportional to the font size.  If the font 
height is very small then this may fail.

You could try setting the preferred font.  See the following link for 
instructions:

http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/platform-swt-
home/faq.html#gtkfontsandcolors

Could you hack your code to have some minimum size or is that just wrong?  I 
think it acually is wrong but might allow us to get farther and not be harmful.

Actually, this problem present on my SUSE (8.2) in case of installation of all 
the standard JA fonts. I can see from the stacktrace that the reason of the 
error is incorrect font size (0??), but this seems to be a standard SUSE font, 
so I'de suggest to change the code to avoid this problem (shoose abother font 
if size is == 0?..). 

I've tried to set different default font using the link above - it helps! 
("Sans 12" where used) So, this could be a temporary workaround for the 
problem.
